definition: to commit one's energy to/to devote oneself to/to sacrifice one's life for/(coll.) (of a woman) to give one's virginity to
to offer/to present/to dedicate/to donate/to show/to put on display/worthy person (old)
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: After he graduated, he joined the army and devoted himself to making his motherland safe.
sentences.chinese: 畢業之後他參加了部隊，獻身於保衛祖國。

sentences.english: I will offer myself to the state as emergency arise.
sentences.chinese: 一旦發生緊急情況，我一定會爲祖國獻身的。

sentences.english: And those fighters seem to have been extremely dedicated.
sentences.chinese: 而這些戰士似乎就是要來獻身的。

sentences.english: I want to devote my life to the prayer that can bring down God's blessing.
sentences.chinese: 我要獻身於禱告，好帶下神的祝福。

sentences.english: What do you think about that Zhao Yazhi was nakedness for public utility?
sentences.chinese: 趙雅芝裸體出鏡，晚節不保還是爲公益獻身？

sentences.english: He has devoted himself to teaching since he graduated from the college in 1962.
sentences.chinese: 他一九六二年大學畢業以後一直獻身教學工作。

sentences.english: Everybody spoke in praise of her devotion to the cause of education.
sentences.chinese: 大家異口同聲地稱讚她獻身教育事業的精神。

sentences.english: She has devoted herself unreservedly to the great cause.
sentences.chinese: 她毫無保留地獻身於這偉大的事業。
但獻身精神是必不可少的。

sentences.english: He wanted to honor the brave men who had died at Gettysburg.
sentences.chinese: 他想表彰那些獻身於葛底斯堡戰役中的勇士們。

sentences.english: Science only bestows the grandest favour on those who concentrate on it.
sentences.chinese: 科學只把最高的恩典賜給專心致志地獻身於科學的人。

sentences.english: Zhou was committed to the cause of language teaching all his life.
sentences.chinese: 周教授將畢生經歷都獻身於語言教育事業。

sentences.english: They were asked to rededicate themselves to their country.
sentences.chinese: 他們不得已爲了國家再次獻身。

sentences.english: This is the day when America remembers those who died in service to their country.
sentences.chinese: 今天是美國民衆紀念爲國獻身者的日子。

sentences.english: A hymn is also dedicated to him alone in Rig Veda.
sentences.chinese: 利俱吠陀也有一首獨一無二獻身於他的詩。

definition: honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
to proclaim/to make public or well known
to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
